onboarding/StartOnboardingDialog.title: Welcome to Letta Cloud
onboarding/StartOnboardingDialog.description: Start your onboarding to learn how to use the platform and get your agents ready for deployment.

CreateTemplate.title: Create a template
CreateTemplate.description: The first thing in building production agents is defining a template. A template is a blueprint for an agent, it defines the structure and behavior of the agent. Create a template by pressing the highlighted button and pick from a starter template.

pages/distribution/LaunchLinks.title: Launch Links
pages/distribution/LaunchLinks.description: Launch links allow you to deploy agents without writing any code. When a user clicks the link below, they will be able to interact with an agent that is unique to them.

LaunchLinkConfiguration.error: There was an error updating the Launch Link configuration, please try again or contact support.

NotCreatedLinkView.title: Let Letta manage your UI
NotCreatedLinkView.info: This feature should be used for quick prototyping and testing, for a more resilient way to work with Agents, check out our SDKs.
NotCreatedLinkView.description: With Launch Links, you can deploy agents without writing any code. Letta will manage the UI for you, users can start using your agent with just a link that creates a unique agent instance for them.

NextJSInstructions.warning: These instructs are for Next.js setups with the app router
NextJSInstructions.install: 1. Install the Letta SDK and Vercel's AI packages
NextJSInstructions.setupEnvironment: 2. Create or append a .env.local file at the root of your application, and add the following environment values:

setupStreaming.title: 3. Create a file at /api/chat/route.ts, this endpoint will be used to stream messages back via an agentId
setupStreaming.label: Code

chatOnTheClient.title: 4. Create a client-component called <Chat /> that will be used to chat with the agent
chatOnTheClient.label: Code

createAgent.title: 5. Create a server component-page with the following code, this will create an agent based on a user's cookie
createAgent.label: Code

PureServerInstructions.warning: The code below should only be used on the server, check out other frameworks for usage with client side code
PureServerInstructions.createAgentCode: 3. Create a function to create an agent from a template
PureServerInstructions.talkToAgent: 4. Write a function to talk to the agent

DistributionOnboardingStepFinal.title: Deploy Your Agent
DistributionOnboardingStepFinal.description:
Congratulations! You're ready to deploy your first agent. Follow the guided instructions to use the Letta API to programmatically deploy agents.

Once deployed, your agent will be ready to chat with users and perform the tasks you've configured.

RecentAgents.title: Recently Deployed

Onboarding.title: Learn how to use Models with Letta
Onboarding.description:
Large language models power the agents that power your applications, with Letta you can choose to bring your own models by adding the keys of popular LLM providers such as OpenAI, Anthropic and Gemini, or use models managed by Letta. 

Models managed by Letta allow you to use popular models without extra access keys, and some are free to use up to a certain amount of requests.

pages/models.title: Models
pages/models.description: View and manage your AI models on Letta Cloud

ModelCostsTable.title: Pricing
ModelCostsTable.description: Costs per model request when using usage-based pricing.
ModelCostsTable.maxContextWindowTooltip: The cost per request is determined by the max context window of your agent.

ModelTypeView.title: Model type

types.standard: Using this model will count towards your plan's Standard request quota. You can use this model beyond your quota if you have credits in your account.
types.premium: Using this model will count towards your plan's Premium request quota. You can use this model beyond your quota if you have credits in your account.
types.perInference: This model only available via usage-based billing. You will be charged based on usage if you have credits in your account.

ModelTypeView.maxContextWindowTooltip: The configured max context window determines the cost per model request.

failed.tooltip: Failed to connect to the model provider, please check your API key and try again.

success.tooltip: Successfully connected to the model provider, you can now add models to this provider.

pages/models/BYOKModels.title: Bring your own key
pages/models/BYOKModels.description: You can provide your own API keys for OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google Gemini. When using models tied to your own API keys, you will be billed directly by the model provider for your usage (subject to their own pricing).

pages/models/LettaManagedModels.title: Available models
pages/models/LettaManagedModels.description: Browse our collection of available models on Letta Cloud. Standard and Premium models are applied towards your plan's request quota. Additional models are available by enabling usage-based billing.

BaseCostCell.perStepInfo: A request is a single inference to the model provider. A single request to the Letta API can trigger multiple steps, depending on how you configure your agent.

standard.label: Standard

OnboardingWrapper.title: What is a template?
OnboardingWrapper.description:
Templates are blueprints for agents. They define the agent's tools, memory, and behavior — and make it easy to create many agents with a shared structure.

In Letta Cloud, templates are the recommended way to create and manage agents at scale, with support for versioning and upgrades.

Create a starter template to claim your reward.

cloudSignup.details: Deploy agents at scale with zero infrastructure

createAgent.title: Create a new agent
createAgent.description: Create an agent on your server

development-servers/agents/CreateAgentDi.serverOffline: Your server is offline, please start it to create a new agent.
development-servers/agents/CreateAgentDi.serverOfflineConnect: Turn on your server with the command below:
development-servers/agents/CreateAgentDi.isFetchingStatus: Sorry, we are still attempting to connect to your server. Please wait a moment.
development-servers/agents/CreateAgentDi.title: Create a new agent

alert.title: You are creating an agent on {serverName}
alert.descriptionLocal: This will create an agent locally on your machine. This will not deploy the agent to Letta Cloud.
alert.descriptionRemote: This will create an agent on the remote server. This will not deploy the agent to Letta Cloud.

development-servers/agents/CreateAgentDi.error: There was an error creating the agent, below is the error message, please try again or contact support.

starterKits.title: Starter kits
starterKits.description: Choose from a starter pack and customize it in the ADE, or start from scratch

components/tutorials.title: Tutorials
components/tutorials.description: Not sure where to start? Check out some of our tutorials

createChatBotWithMemory.title: Create a chatbot app with memory
createChatBotWithMemory.description: Build a chatbot that can adapt over time using long-term memory

buildMultiAgentSystems.title: Built a multi-agent system
buildMultiAgentSystems.description: Create a multi-agent system with an orchestrator and multiple workers

discord.title: Create a Discord bot
discord.description: Connect Letta agents to Discord to create Discord bots

voice.title: Activate voice mode
voice.description: Chat with your Letta agents using voice using our native integration

development-servers/shared/CreateLocalAg.info: This will create an agent locally on your machine. This does not deploy the agent to Letta Cloud.
development-servers/shared/CreateLocalAg.title: Create a new agent

development-servers/add.title: Add remote server
development-servers/add.description: To add a remote server, you need to enable your remote letta server to accept public connections and add the --secure and --ade flags.
development-servers/add.error: There was an error adding the remote server, please try again or contact support.

url.label: Server URL
url.description: Must be in the format as follows http://my-server-url.com, or http://my-server-url.com:8000

password.label: Server password
password.description: This should be the randomly generated password when you started the server with --secure

UpdateDevelopmentServerDetailsDialog.title: Update remote server connection
UpdateDevelopmentServerDetailsDialog.error: There was an error updating the remote server, please try again or contact support.

url.label: Server URL
url.error: This is not a valid URL, please make sure it is in the format http://my-server-url.com

development-servers/page.title: Local agents
development-servers/page.description: View your available agents running inside the Letta server

ErrorView.title: There has been an issue connecting to this server
ErrorView.description: We were not able to connect to your development server, please make sure it is running and accessible from the internet.
ErrorView.localConnection: Please make sure your local server is running and accessible from the internet.
ErrorView.runTheServer: Run the following command to start the server:

connection.title: Below is your current connection configuration:

OnboardingWrapper.title: Save Your Template
OnboardingWrapper.description:
Save your changes by creating a new version of your template.

Each version is preserved, allowing you to track changes over time and upgrade agents to newer versions when ready.

projects/(projectSlug)/agents/(agentId)/.error: There was a severe error in this application, please refresh this page. If the error persists, please contact support in the top right corner.

VersionAgentDialog.mobileWarning: Versioning templates are only available on desktop, as there is a lot of information to display.

onboarding.title: Before saving, we will show you the changes you've made to this template, if you're satisfied with the changes or just want to test saving, press the save button at the bottom of the screen.

VersionAgentDialog.title: Save Template
VersionAgentDialog.description: Versioning an agent creates a new version of the agent that is immutable and can be used to deploy agents. Are you sure you want to proceed?
VersionAgentDialog.migrate: Migrate all deployed agents to this version
VersionAgentDialog.migrateDescription: Selecting this option will migrate all deployed agents to this version, to programmatically migrate agents, visit the <link>API documentation</link>.

message.label: Version message
message.description: A description of the changes in this version

CloudUpsellDeploy.title: Deploy your agents on Letta Cloud
CloudUpsellDeploy.description: Letta Cloud allows you to deploy agents at scale with zero infrastructure.

CreateTemplateButton.error: There was an error converting this agent to a template, please try again or contact support.
CreateTemplateButton.title: Convert your agent to a template
CreateTemplateButton.description: Agent templates allow you to create common starting points that new agents can fork from. Templates support memory variables and can be versioned.

DeploymentButton.errorTooltip: There was an error fetching template information, please refresh the page or contact support.

readyToDeploy.heading: Your template is ready to use
readyToDeploy.copy: You can create new agents from your agent template via the ADE and API.

updateAvailable.heading: Template has unsaved changes
updateAvailable.copy: Consider saving a new template version. Agents deployed using your template will use the latest version (v{version}).
updateAvailable.copyNoVersion: Consider saving a new template version. Agents deployed using your template will use the latest version.

ForkAgentDialog.error: There was an error forking this agent, please try again or contact support.
ForkAgentDialog.title: Fork {agentBaseType}
ForkAgentDialog.description: Forking an {agentBaseType} creates a new template with the same configuration as the original template.

projects/(projectSlug)/agents/(agentId)/.liveAgentWarning: You are editing a live agent, be aware that editing this agent may impact live deployments
projects/(projectSlug)/agents/(agentId)/.localAgentDevelopment: You are editing a local agent, changes made here will not effect your agents on Letta Cloud
projects/(projectSlug)/agents/(agentId)/.positionError: There was a unhandled error while positioning the window, will fallback to default position, we have notified our team about this issue.

noCloudAccess.title: You do not have permission to view this page
noCloudAccess.description: You need to have access to Letta Cloud to manage your API keys. If you are using a local deployment, you do not need to create API keys. If you want to secure your local/self-hosted letta instance, check out this <link>documentation</link>.

api-keys/page.title: API keys
api-keys/page.errorMessage: An error occurred while fetching your API keys. Please try again or contact support.

deleteApiKeyDialog.title: Delete {apiKeyName}
deleteApiKeyDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete your API Key? This is permanent and cannot be undone.

createAPIKeyDialog.title: Create a new API key
createAPIKeyDialog.generatedCopy: We have generated you an API Key, please make sure to store it safely.
createAPIKeyDialog.description: Provide a descriptive name for identifying this API key
createAPIKeyDialog.label: API key name

StageAndDeployDialog.title: Are you sure you want to version your template?
StageAndDeployDialog.details: This creates a version of your agent template that is immutable and can be used to deploy agents. Are you sure you want to proceed?

ADE/DeploymentAgentMangerPanel.emptyMessage: You haven't versioned this template yet. Click the button above to create a version of your agent template.

ADE/Welcome.title: Welcome to the Letta ADE!
ADE/Welcome.message: The Letta ADE is where you can create, customize and deploy your agents. You can even arrange the windows to suit your workflow, just drag the tabs.
ADE/Welcome.more: Right now you are in a template called <templateName></templateName>. You can customize this template in many ways, here are a few things you can do:
ADE/Welcome.editMemoryBlocks: Edit your template's <editCoreMemoriesButton></editCoreMemoriesButton> and customize who your agent is and who it talks to.
ADE/Welcome.editDataSources: Attach <editDataSourcesButton></editDataSourcesButton> to your template so your agent can look up information from external sources.
ADE/Welcome.simulate: Use the <agentSimulatorButton></agentSimulatorButton> to test talking to a deployed agent
ADE/Welcome.exploreArchivalMemories: Explore the <archivalMemoriesButton></archivalMemoriesButton> of your agents (see what your agents have learned).
ADE/Welcome.evenMore: When you're ready to create agents from your template, you can visit the <templateVersionButton></templateVersionButton> and create a new version of your template, then follow the instructions on that page to deploy your agents.

login/LoginComponent.title: Welcome to Letta Cloud
login/LoginComponent.info: By clicking the button above, you will be signed in to an existing account or have an new account created for you.
login/LoginComponent.terms: This will also mean you agree to our <terms>Terms of Service</terms> and <privacy>Privacy Policy</privacy>.

sso-login.title: Sign in to Letta via SSO

errors.invalidSSO: Your email domain was not associated with a valid SSO provider, please try again or contact your organization administrator.
errors.default: There was an error signing in, please try again or contact support

VerifyAccountLoginWrapper.info: If you want to skip verification process, you can instead sign up with our social login options. <link>Sign out here</link> to return to the login page.

errors.emailAlreadyVerified: Your email address is already verified
errors.default: There was an error sending the verification email, please try again or contact support

pages/password.title: Sign up for Letta Cloud

errors.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 6 characters

pages/password.terms: By signing up, you agree to our <terms>Terms of Service</terms> and <privacy>Privacy Policy</privacy>.
pages/password.info: You will be asked to provide a valid phone number after signing up to verify your account. If you do not want to provide a phone number, please sign in through our <link>other options</link>.

datasources/jobs.title: Ingestion jobs
datasources/jobs.subtitle: View and manage your data ingestion jobs

errors.default: There was an error signing in, please try again or contact support

errors.minLength: Password must be at least 6 characters
errors.codeRequired: A code is required to reset your password
errors.invalidCode: The code you are using is invalid, please try again or contact support.
errors.codeExpired: The code you are using has expired, please try again or contact support.
errors.default: There was an error resetting your password, please try again or contact support

code.label: Code
code.placeholder: Enter the code you received in your email

forgot-password.title: Forgot your password?
forgot-password.description: Enter your email address and we will send you a link to reset your password.

errors.default: There was an error sending the reset link, please try again or contact support

forgot-password.success: We have sent you an email with a link to reset your password. Please check your inbox and follow the instructions in the email.

errors.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 6 characters
errors.invalidInviteCode: The invite code you are using is invalid, please contact the organization administrator for a new invite link.
errors.emailAlreadyTaken: This email is already in use, please contact support if you cannot access your account
errors.default: There was an error creating your account, please try again or contact support

errors.expired: This invite link has expired, please contact the organization administrator for a new invite link.
errors.mismatch: The email address you are using does not match the one on the invite. Please sign in with the correct email address.
errors.invalid: This invite link is invalid, please contact the organization administrator for a new invite link.

signup-via-invite.title: Welcome
signup-via-invite.more: Use the buttons below to complete sign up.

MigrationsTable.error: There was an error loading migrations, please try again or contact support.
MigrationsTable.noMigrations: We could not find any migrations for this template, you can migrate agents when you create a new version of your template.

pages/migrations.title: Template Migrations
pages/migrations.description: Migrations are a way to update your agent templates to the latest version of Letta. This is useful when you want to take advantage of new features or bug fixes.

data-sources/files/page.title: Source Files
data-sources/files/page.error: There was an error loading files, please try again or contact support.

DistributionOnboardingStep.title: Distribute Your Agent
DistributionOnboardingStep.description:
Ready to deploy your agent to production? The distribution tab lets you create agents from your template and manage them in Letta Cloud.

You'll find options for API keys, framework integrations, and usage tracking.
